body.h3: Some files don't play back or aren't loaded into the library.

blockquote.p: See this tracker bug on GStreamer (only applicable if you use the GStreamer player).

body.h3: When I try to import a folder to my library, Rhythmbox crashes. What do I do now?

blockquote.p: Run Rhythmbox from a terminal passing it the -d option, and import the folder which crashes Rhythmbox. It will display a lot of information, and should tell you which file it was trying to import when it crashed. Move away that file from the folder and try again. You'll often find that it's a wma or Quicktime file which make GStreamer crash. Once you spotted the bad file, file a bug on bugzilla.gnome.org and make the file available to the developers somehow.

body.h3: I'm using Fedora, and Rhythmbox can't import nor play mp3 files. What's wrong?

blockquote.p: Red Hat can't ship mp3 players as part of Fedora because of legal issues. Follow these instructions to get GStreamer packages with mp3 support.

body.h3: I would like to use the Xine player instead of the GStreamer one. How can I enable it?

blockquote.p: The xine-lib backend was removed as it was unmaintained, and GStreamer reached the necessary standards for Rhythmbox' use. It also allows use to do things like Music sharing and Audio CD creation otherwise not possible with the xine-lib backend.

body.h3: When I start Rhythmbox, I get this "failed to activate the shell: (null)" dialog box. What can I do about this?

blockquote.p: This issue is caused when Rhythmbox is not installed in the same prefix as GNOME (bonobo-activation, specifically). The easy workaround for this is to pass --no-registration to Rhythmbox. You may also link the GNOME_Rhythmbox.server file into your prefix/lib/bonobo/servers directory.

body.h3: Why will preferences not let me edit my song tag info?

blockquote.p: Some mp3s are not detected properly by GStreamer. Rhythmbox supports id3 tag editing as an experimental feature. This is a feature that will be supported at some point in the future. Use the --enable-tag-writing flag to configure to enable it, at your own risk obviously.

body.h3: So if I cannot edit my song tags in Rhythmbox, what is the best way?

blockquote.p: A 3rd party application like EasyTAG will allow you to edit your song information.

body.h3: Would it be possible to have a Clear button next to the search entry?

blockquote.p: This was discussed numerous times on the mailing-list. Please read the thread on the mailing-list, as well as the resolved bug.
